Seeker.title: Seeker - Location Permission Phishing Tool
Seeker.description: Seeker is a simple tool that hosts a fake website requesting location permissions, similar to many popular location-based websites. If the target grants permission, their location data is captured.
Seeker.additionalInfo:
Seeker hosts a fake webpage that requests location permissions from the target. If the target grants the location permission, it captures their geographical data.

Example usage:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory.
2. Make the install script executable and run it.
3. The tool sets up a server hosting the fake location request page.
4. Once the target grants location permission, their location is captured.

Brutex.title: BruteX - Automated Brute Force Tool
Brutex.description: BruteX is an automated brute force tool that targets and attempts to crack passwords for all services running on a given target system.
Brutex.additionalInfo:
BruteX automatically brute forces all services running on the target machine by attempting password cracking on exposed services.

Example usage:
1. Update and upgrade the system packages.
2. Install git and clone the BruteX repository.
3. Navigate to the BruteX directory and install the required dependencies.
4. Run BruteX against a target system by specifying the target's IP and port.
5. BruteX will attempt to crack passwords for all detected services.

Anonphisher.title: Anonphisher - Automated Phishing Tool
Anonphisher.description: A phishing tool by AnonyminHack5 that provides 51+ phishing templates and an inbuilt reverse proxy to generate and send phishing links easily.
Anonphisher.additionalInfo:
Anonphisher is a fully automated phishing tool made with pure Bash script. It allows users to phish various websites using pre-built templates and a built-in reverse proxy.

Example usage:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory.
2. Run the script and select a phishing template.
3. Send the generated phishing link to the target.
4. Captured credentials will be displayed in the terminal.

NethunterIntermux.title: NetHunter-In-Termux - Kali Linux NetHunter on Termux
NethunterIntermux.description: NetHunter-In-Termux is a simple Bash script that installs Kali Linux NetHunter on an unrooted Android device using Termux. It allows users to access a full Kali NetHunter command-line interface on Android.
NethunterIntermux.additionalInfo:
NetHunter-In-Termux installs Kali Linux NetHunter in Termux without the need for root access on your Android device.

Example usage:
1. Update and install git on Termux.
2. Clone the NetHunter-In-Termux repository and navigate to the directory.
3. Make the installation script executable and run it to install NetHunter.
4. Use 'nethunter' command to start the Kali NetHunter CLI interface.
5. 'nethunter kex passwd' sets the Kex password (only needed for the first time).
6. 'nethunter kex &' starts the VNC server.
7. 'nethunter kex stop' stops the VNC server.
8. Run specific commands within the NetHunter environment using 'nethunter <command>'.
9. 'nethunter -r' starts NetHunter CLI as root.

camphish.title: Camera Phishing Tool
camphish.description: This tool captures images from the target's front camera or PC webcam by sending a malicious link.
code: apt-get -y install php openssh git wget
camphish.additionalInfo:
Once executed, this script sets up a phishing page to trick the target into allowing webcam access.

Example usage:
1. Run the script and choose a phishing method.
2. Send the generated link to the target.
3. If the target clicks the link and grants access, images will be captured and saved.
